00030 Text::Text (string content) : content_(content), proportionality_(FONT_PROPORTIONAL), wordRates_(vector<WordRate>(0))
00031 {
00032     // Initialize the vector of styles according to the number of characters in the content
00033     styles_ = vector<Style>(content.length());

00086 void Text::addCharacter (char character, Style style, unsigned int position)
00087 {
00088     // The desired position exceeds the content length, so we append to the of the text
00089     if(position > length())
00090     {
00091         content_ += character;
00092         styles_.push_back(style);
00093     }
00094     else
00095     {
00096         // Check for a valid position, though a compiler should use a big value when a negative
00097         // number is assigned to an unsigned int
00098         if (position < 0)
00099         {
00100             position = 0;
00101         }
00102                 
00103         // Declare two iterators for pointing to the desired position
00104         string::iterator contentIterator        = content_.begin();
00105         vector<Style>::iterator stylesIterator  = styles_.begin();
00106         
00107         // Advance the iterators until the desired position
00108         while (position > 1)
00109         {
00110             ++contentIterator;
00111             ++stylesIterator;
00112 
00113             --position;
00114         }
00115         
00116         // Insert the character and its style
00117         content_.insert(contentIterator, character);
00118         styles_.insert(stylesIterator, style);
00119     }
00120     
00121     // Rebuild the appearance rate of every word in text
00122     computeWordRates();
00123 };

00192 void Text::removeCharacter (unsigned int position)
00193 {
00194     // Check for a valid position
00195     if (position > length())
00196     {
00197         position = length();
00198     }
00199     
00200     // Declare two iterators for pointing to the desired character and its style
00201     string::iterator contentIterator        = content_.begin();
00202     vector<Style>::iterator stylesIterator  = styles_.begin();
00203     
00204     // Advance the iterators until the desired position
00205     while (position > 1)
00206     {
00207         ++contentIterator;
00208         ++stylesIterator;
00209         
00210         --position;
00211     }
00212     
00213     // Remove the character and its style
00214     content_.erase(contentIterator);
00215     styles_.erase(stylesIterator);
00216     
00217     // Rebuild the appearance rate of every word in text
00218     computeWordRates();
00219 };

00236 Style Text::getCharacterStyle (unsigned int position) const
00237 {
00238     if (position >= length())
00239         return Style();
00240     else
00241         return styles_[position];
00242 };

00382 void Text::updateWordRate (string word)
00383 {
00384     // Searches the word in the vector
00385     vector<WordRate>::iterator wordRates;
00386     for (wordRates = wordRates_.begin(); wordRates != wordRates_.end(); ++wordRates)
00387     {
00388         // Updates its appearance rate
00389         if ( (*wordRates).first == word )
00390         {
00391             (*wordRates).second++;
00392             return;
00393         }
00394     }
00395     
00396     // The word was not stored, so here we adds its first appearance
00397     wordRates_.push_back(WordRate(word, 1));
00398 };
00399 
00400 
00409 void Text::computeWordRates ()
00410 {   
00411     vector<string> words;   // Vector to hold our words after removing spaces
00412     
00413     // Extract the words in text
00414     tokenize(words);
00415     
00416     // Update appearance rate of every word extracted
00417     vector<string>::iterator wordsIterator;
00418     for (wordsIterator = words.begin(); wordsIterator != words.end(); ++wordsIterator)
00419         updateWordRate(*wordsIterator);
00420         
00421     // This sorting will improve future lookups
00422     sort (wordRates_.begin(), wordRates_.end());
00423 };
00424 
00425 
00433 void Text::tokenize(vector<string>& tokens, const string& delimiters) const
00434 {
00435     // Skip delimiters at the beginning of text
00436     string::size_type lastPos = content_.find_first_not_of(delimiters, 0);
00437     
00438     // Find the first "non-delimiter"
00439     string::size_type pos     = content_.find_first_of(delimiters, lastPos);
00440     
00441     // Traverse the content until reaching its end
00442     while (string::npos != pos || string::npos != lastPos)
00443     {
00444         // A word has been found, add it to the vector
00445         tokens.push_back(content_.substr(lastPos, pos - lastPos));
00446         
00447         // Skip delimiters again
00448         lastPos = content_.find_first_not_of(delimiters, pos);
00449         
00450         // Find the next "non-delimiter"
00451         pos = content_.find_first_of(delimiters, lastPos);
00452     }
00453 };
